description: Erection of first floor side infill extension, replacement of flat roof on existing two storey side extension with hipped roof,  hip to gable conversion and rear dormer roof extension to facilitate a loft conversion
decision_conditions: By virtue of the proposed hipped and gable roof forms, and the excessive size of the proposed rear dormer extension, the proposed development would cause harm to the character and appearance of the host dwelling and the surrounding area. The proposal would therefore be contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policies CS8 and DM10 of the adopted Core Strategy (2012) and Policy Guidance 36, 39 and paragraph 4.29 of the Council's Residential Design Supplementary Planning Document (2013).

The site comprises a building (Use Class E).The application seeks to install 1no. internally illuminated fascia sign and 1no. projecting signThe key areas of assessment are:- The impact of the proposal on the character and appearance of the area; - The impact of the proposal on neighbouring residential amenity; and,- The impact of the proposal on highway safety.When read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: The proposed development is considered appropriate for a commercial premises and there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment:  A condition to restrict the hours which the fascia signs can be illuminated and a condition to limit the illumination level of the signs is proposed. Subject to the satisfaction of these conditions it is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties.Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy seeks to ensure that new development has regard to local traffic conditions and does not contribute to congestion, on street car parking pressure, or compromise pedestrian or highway safety.   Officer Comment: Officers consider that the proposals would not be significantly different from the existing situation and would therefore have no adverse impact upon highways and transportation, thereby complying with Core Strategy Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy, 2012.In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).
